text: instead so for you what is this dispute
about at its heart okay so the basic
thing is that ninety-eight percent of
the doctors who work at a ninety percent
of the junior doctors have said that
this try a new contract is not safe for
patients it's not fair for the doctors
and that's why we're striking I don't to
go into too much detail about the
contract but ninety eight percent of
people said it's unsafe this is a
dispute that's been rumbling on for
years now I was probably still it was
going when you before you qualified I
think so so but I it seems that you know
progress has been made in it now seems
to have come down to this issue about
how much you get paid for working on a
Saturday mm well there are a few current
issues with the contracts one of the big
issues at that is that the government is
going to impose a contract they're not
good they're going to say if you don't
negotiate we will impose a contract on
you whether you like it or not and it's
just frankly dangerous do you accept the
government's argument that this is also
about trying to improve the quality of
care offered to patients at weekends
definitely we all want to improve the
NHS one of the things the government
wants to do is a seven-day NHS service
we already work seven days a week what
the government wants to do is make
elective work seven days a week okay and
they want to do that with five days
funding that will stretch the doctors
even further and frankly it's unsafe the
job of Health Secretary is to do the
right thing for patients and we've now
had eight studies in the last five years
that have shown mortality rates or
weekends are higher than they should be
a my job to do something about that but
I want to do it working together with
doctors who all want to do the right
thing for patients we now have sold
nearly every area of outstanding
disagreement with the BMA there's just
the one issue about pay rates for
Saturday's and what we're offering is
something that is better for doctors who
work regularly on a Saturday and for
nurses working in the same hospital and
for the ambulance driver who takes a
patient to the hospital than for the
healthcare assistants in that hospital I
think it's a good deal it's a fair deal
and we should be working together to do
the right thing for patients
